DOC.brief_summary: In study , investigator aim determine whether non-invasive autonomic modulation decrease inflammation complication thoracic surgery . The investigator test hypothesis low-level transcutaneous vagal nerve stimulation ( LLVNS ) major thoracic surgery reduce inflammation complication , particularly postoperative atrial fibrillation ( POAF ) . This prospective randomized pilot trial 200 patient undergoing major thoracic surgery include lobectomy , bilobectomy , pneumonectomy via either video-assisted thoracoscopic ( VAT ) open thoracotomy . Patients randomize receive ether ) LLVNS ( n=100 ) b ) sham LLVNS ( n=100 ) procedure . All patient receive standardize anesthetic , surgical , post-surgical care . The primary outcome study time occurrence in-hospital POAF , compare group use Cox proportional hazard model . Secondary outcome ICU hospital length stay , postoperative morbidity , postoperative mortality , serologic marker inflammation .
